newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft reports sharp rise in profits.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft reports sharp rise in profits.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. Thursday reported an 88 percent rise in fiscal fourth quarter profit, reflecting strong sales of its Windows NT software and Office suite applications.

The world's largest software maker earned $1.05 billion, or 80 cents a share, in the three months ended in June, up from $559 million, or 43 cents a share, a year earlier. Revenues rose 41 percent to $3.18 billion from $2.26 billion.
The earnings were in line with Wall Street estimates, which on average called for Microsoft to report earnings of 79 cents a share, according to First Call.
Microsoft executives credited the strong growth to sales of Windows applications and operating system software, particularly the high-end 32-bit Windows NT products.
A company executive said in a statement that Windows NT Server shipments in the quarter doubled compared with the year-ago quarter.
But Microsoft Chief Financial Officer Mike Brown said in a statement that the company continues to expect its revenue growth rate to slow next year.
